info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Transylvania and southeastern Haywood Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 215 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northwest of Brevard, or near Graveyard Fields, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Graveyard Fields, Mount Pisgah, Looking Glass, Black Balsam Area, B.R. Parkway-Black Balsam To Mount Pisgah and Cruso. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
